did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Pamphlets, printed matter, and photographs related to Miller's research on animal nutrition and beef cattle production.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Professor of animal science, New York State College of Agriculture and Life Sciences, Cornell University.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Pamphlets, printed matter, and photographs related to Miller's research on animal nutrition and beef cattle production.

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: New York State College of Agriculture and Life Sciences--Faculty.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: John Ivan Miller papers, #21-14-1915. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

did.unittitle: Reports on protein efficiency for lambs ( 1937-1944 ).
Feeding trial reports with beef cattle involving the relative feeding values of numerous feeds. Also, some notes on the development of the beef herds at Cornell starting in 1930
Reports of a few meats projects.
Summary of activities of the Cornell Livestock Judging Team 1936-1963 ).
Some unpublished information on salt intakes and the use of medicated salt for cattle.
History and development of Herd Classification Program in New York and for the American Angus Association.
Acid preservation of high-moisture corn for feeding beef cattle (first work in U.S. done at Cornell).
A few photographs involving beef cattle which may have historical interest.
